alert.note: Alert for Boone; Kanawha; Northwest Fayette (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 6:59PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A line of gusty showers will impact portions of southeastern Kanawha, northwestern Fayette and northeastern Boone Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 656 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of gusty showers from Ashford to Coal Fork, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Montgomery, Chesapeake, Marmet, Belle, Cedar Grove, East Bank, Glasgow, Smithers, Gauley Bridge, Pratt, Burnwell, Powellton, Handley, Seth, Leewood, Dawes, Ashford, Sharon and Eskdale. This includes West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 66 and 94. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
